alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:20PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz affecting Mineral County. East Walker River Above Strosnider Ditch Near Mason affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated flows caused by snowmelt are expected to continue, with higher flows oscillating around minor flood stage through at least July 7. * WHERE...West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding of lowlands pasture & rural roads in West Walker River Canyon and Antelope Valley including Walker, Coleville and Topaz California. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 6.0 feet just after midnight tonight. Similar peaks are anticipated Wednesday and Thursday nights as well. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when camping or hiking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon.
